title: Is The Great Gatsby overrated? - Quora

response.answer_text: Do you mean the original movie with Robert Redford (1974), the re-do (2013) or F. Scott Fitzgerald’s novel? If you refer to the movies, the book presents an opportunity for an extravaganza for costumes, wealth, the romance of the era between the World Wars…so Hollywood goes for the glitz. I thought the 1974 movie was well done. I walked out on the 2013 version. I like the book, primarily for its use of a first person narrator who isn’t the main character.

Although the high school reading list should be open to new works “the Great Gatsby” still deserves its place as a story about social status and what people will do to earn or keep their membership in the club.
